page.title: 14ELMBRIDGE - GARDENING
page.content: Most gardens are spacious and retain mature trees. Many gardens use water as an interesting feature, either natural or artificially added. Some old water pumps have been kept and a few are still in working order. Sandstone, being the local stone, is widely used for edging, rockeries and walls. Lawns are featured in every garden, often large and sweeping, bordered with well established wide shrubberies. Colour is added by perennials and heathers under planted with bulbs for the spring. Fruit trees are scattered around the garden but vegetables, if grown, are generally screened from view. Normally included are paved sitting out areas possibly with a built-in barbeque. Gardens are lovingly maintained.
